jam.sort
Interface Controller

All Known Implementing Classes:
RunControl
public interface Controller

Interface that a class for data taking must implement. Contains methods that SortDaemon and StorageDaemon call when done sorting and writing out data.

Since:
JDK 1.1
Version:
0.9
Author:
Ken Swartz, Dale Visser

Method Summary
 void atSortEnd()
          Called back by sortDaemon thread when sort encounters a end-run-marker or a end of file marker.
 void atSortStart()
          Called back by SortDaemon thread when starting a new sort.
 void atWriteEnd()
          Method called back by StorageDaemon when it encouters a end-run-marker and has closed the data event file it was writing data to.
 boolean isSortNext()
          Called by SortDaemon when it needs to start the next stream.
 

Method Detail

atSortStart

public void atSortStart()
                 throws GlobalException
Called back by SortDaemon thread when starting a new sort.
OFFLINE
begins a new sort
ONLINE
does nothing

GlobalException

atSortEnd

public void atSortEnd()
Called back by sortDaemon thread when sort encounters a end-run-marker or a end of file marker.

isSortNext

public boolean isSortNext()
Called by SortDaemon when it needs to start the next stream.
OFFLINE
gets a new input stream
ONLINE
does nothing.

atWriteEnd

public void atWriteEnd()
Method called back by StorageDaemon when it encouters a end-run-marker and has closed the data event file it was writing data to.
